Having electively experienced taking an online Drivers Safety Course

Having electively experienced taking a Drivers Safety course in the past with an instructor I find this online methodology much better. It is not boring or uncomfortable and gives you the freedom to do other tasks, if necessary, i.e., a bathroom break, a snack, to rest your eyes, to regain your concentration and most importantly to learn how dangerous driving can be. In fact, I have taken a few screen shots to share with people that I know so they recognize their safety for others shortcomings while driving.

Relaxed and Informative!

Very relaxed and informative!

TEST SOONER on LESS INFO PER TEST

Considering that this test is designed for "mature" drivers, my suggestion would be to have more tests that cover less material per test. I found myself sometimes a bit overwhelmed with the amount of statistics and variety of material before being tested. Worrying that you won't remember the potential question on the many statistics causes one to become anxious and therefore not retain the more important points of each section. It is interesting, however, that the final section was the most difficult for me and I scored 100% which made me feel it was worth the extra time I gave each section.

I had to take a traffic school course…

I had to take a traffic school course and provide a certificate to the court, however I never received one!

Once the company obtained my card information, the charges kept occurring on my account, they aggressively sign you up for some unknown services, so I had to call my bank and block my card!

After hours on the phone with customer service reps, I’ve been told that apparently I’ve put those requests myself that’s why those charges showed up 😂 Their rebuttal sentence: “You have put the request yourself, that’s why there’s a charge”,”You registered the second account and paid again”,”You’ve called in and requested for this and that…”

I pulled out other clients feedbacks and many unhappy customers were, apparently, signed up for services they never requested for

I reported website to the federal consumer protection as well as looking to take legal action against it!

Please, do not give them you card number, they are scammers and fraudsters! Better pay for your traffic ticket or just take a course at your local traffic school, more hustle but SAFE!

I just called my credit card company and filed a dispute so that I won't have to pay for the nothing burger that I got. Amazing what this company gets away with. They must pay somebody off to be able to be on the Texas website of defensive driving schools. Ridiculous and a true scheme.

Updated—— the service was perfect. When I arrived at the road test site the person there already had my info in system. Just bring ur printed completion paper, I had that and was all good. Didn’t get result for road test until about 7pm and tested at 930am. This is a great service.


I will consider changing my rating if I can get some clarity on the process from the company. I signed up for and completed my NY State Pre License course. The course itself was well run and the verifications were no problem at all. I would give the program 5/5 with the ability to do this at home at own pace online. HERE IS THE PROBLEM THOUGH-- Upon completion I received an email stating that I have passed. It definitely does take alot of time, so I was excited to be finished and figured I would easily be on my way to schedule road test. I went to the DMV website to schedule my road test. They REQUIRE a certificate # in order to schedule the appointment. There is NO CERTIICATE # PROVIDED on the completion email. It simply says that IDRIVESAFELY will notify the DMV within 24-48 hrs. Now even when they notify the DMV, I will need a certificate # in order to schedule this appointment. There is no way around it. How do I get my certiicate # and schedule an appointment for road test? What is the protocol in NY State if the customer servce rep I spoke with says " they dont issue certificatein NY". The company was listed on the DMV website as approved as well, so you wish this was done with more clarity. I hope to hear back from the company and if this situation is rectified I would happily change my rating. The low rating is based solely on the lack of certificate # which I need to proceed. PS- why did they enroll me in Road side assistance for $5 p/mo on the low. That was pretty sneaky.

I don't drive on snow/ice or through deep water.

The RV section is not applicable to me. I don't have a RV, never drove one, don't plan to. I don't have a trailer hitch on my car and don't tow anything, such as a camper. I drive less than 8,000 miles a year, mainly to doctor appointments.

The iDriveSafely course was good....here's how it could be better.

The iDriveSafely course was mostly as expected. I was surprised that most of the statistics come from 2011--and it is 2022. They really should proof their materials better. One or 2 questions in Test 1 were not discussed until the following chapter. That happened more than once throughout the course. Also, I think asking questions on the test about good driving strategies rather than numbers or statistics is a better measure of what people actually should learn and remember. The statistics make a point, but the strategies offered provide techniques that I can use everyday to be a better driver. You want "learners" to read the information and remember and employ the strategies that actually help people perform better on the streets and highways.

A Most Satisfying Mature Driver's Course

The online course was fun to go through, and I learned a lot by getting a refresher on driving safety, new vehicle technologies, and more. I felt the course content was thorough and adequately covered.

I only have three complaints. First, I am able to read and digest information fast, but was frustrated by the timers imposed on each unit or segment that prevented me from progressing through the entire course more quickly. I know that "I Drive Safely" is not responsible for that given federal regulations on the three-hour requirement for such courses. Nevertheless, it was frustrating for me. However, the positive is that it gave me time to get a cup of coffee or to review any information more carefully. The second complaint has to do with the wrong landing page for reviewing incorrect quiz answers. As for the latter, you can review what you got wrong, but sometimes you are shown a page that does not match what you got wrong. The final complaint is that much of the traffic data is from 2011, which makes me wonder about how often the course is updated to reflect current information (unless this is typical of all online courses).

Overall, I enjoyed taking the course and would recommend it to others. The course is reasonably priced, especially for repeat customers. There is also a discount for future courses, which is nice. I look forward to continuing my mature driver's discount with our insurer.

It signs you up for monthly $5…

It signs you up for monthly $5 subscription without properly informing you. Also, on Chapter 4, section 7, it shows you a 15 minute video on drunk driving and right after the video, it ask you a quiz question nothing to with the video. I think the question is for some other video. You just have to guess the answer since you have no clue what the question is referring to. I kept on picking wrong answer and it kept on repeating the same video. I have watched the same video 4 times and still haven’t been able to guess the correct answer. I called the company and got a recording saying I called during off business hours. Well, I called at 2:00pm California time. Not sure what their office time is. I am very frustrated as this is going no where. Also, several places, the verbiage is not the same as the readout. Seems like the voice is old recording and the text is newer version. Someone needs to update this program. It has wasted a lot of my time!
Excellent course!

Bad Customer Service

The program is great and super easy! Learned a few things and it was fun to do! Super long as expected. One issue I had was that they did not have an option to send it to the court house. I paid for an expedited copy but I thought that meant it would be sent to my house. Does not specify that it does not. So I called and emailed about how it can get sent to me. They explained that it would be an additional $10 fee for it to be printed out and sent to me. So I asked if I can use the expedited amount to put towards that because al they did is post it on my IDriveSafe account. And they said no... but what I don't get is why they make you pay money for it to be a picture to be expedited if they can't just send it. Customer service was terrible. I will never recommend this to anyone again.

Deceptive: Defaults to recurring charge for unwanted service

The super slow timer for each section is terrible but worse yet, somewhere in the process they defaulted me into buying recurring $5 a month roadside assistance. I wasn't aware that I signed up for it and never wanted or used it. I wouldn't even now how to if I wanted to. My wife told me that I've been paying them for months for a service that I NEVER wanted and didn't know I had. When I took on the project of cancelling, I first called their customer service at 10am pacific time and it went to voicemail. Clearly they are counting on people to not get around to cancelling or putting it off when it isn't easy to find how to cancel. I am sure they can point to the place where some screen I clicked through had an option to opt out, but it's clearly their business plan to sell people indefinitely a service that they don't consciously choose. Deceptive and unethical. Yuck! Edit: They replied below to clarify how their intentionally deceptive sign up process works. I got curious to see if I could actually use the roadside service. Turns out I would have to find the roadside assistance phone # then find an email they say they sent me to find my id#. This assumes I even know I have the service. Almost pure profit for them because almost no roadside service actually provided (and surely farmed out if someone figures out they have it and use it). Great business model if you don't have a conscience.

It's 2021.... But Locked out for not completing by due date of 08-10-2010

I received my first speeding ticket in at least 10 year in June 2021, I paid the ticket and the case was resolved.. Easy enough.
But, 10 day later I received A letter from The Michigan Department of State Information Center telling me I could midigate the effects of the citation through the Michigan's Basic Driver Improvement Course (BDIC) Program.
By successful completing the BDIC Program I would not have any points added to my driving record and they would also not disclose the situation to my insurance company.

So I looked into the options provided in the letter and eventually chose to registered for the Michigan Basic Driver Improvement Course offered by I Drive Safely, and made plans to get the work completed by the Deadline provided in my letter, it states complete the program no later then 11:59pm 08-10-2021.
So, today is 08-04-2021 and it was time to get to work. I logged into the program, and started the course. I finished Level 1 Chapter 1.. easy enough then I completed Level 2 Chapter 1, moving along well. Next I click to launch Level 2 Chapter 2 and this error message popped up.
"Course locked
Per state regulations, your course has expired because your court deadline date has passed. We will report this course to the state as "failed."
Then I notice something strange in the course heading area which said "Michigan Basic Driver Improvement Course
15% course complete
Complete by: 08/10/2010
Course overview"
What?! Complete by: 08/10/2010 !?
I am not sure what the remedy will be, but I hope I Drive Safely corrects this obvious technical issue, quickly, and without me fighting them over it.
I have six children, a full time college student, and worker. I don't want this to become a thing, please rectify the situation, that's all I am hoping for now.

***Update*** 08/04/2021
A Customer Experience Hero from I Drive Safely, Skylar D. Looked into my situation and it indeed was set to expire 08-10-2010 (my fault when registering I’m sure) and corrected the complete by date to 08-10-2021. I received a nice email informing me of the findings, and that I could now continue my course where I left off.
I appreciate the speedy response and commend the ease of resolving this issue, no run around or guilt trips, just simply corrected.

Thank you,
Bryan

The timer's you have to wait for to change the page make it not worth it!!

You have to wait for a timer for each page, which makes the course even longer than it needs to be..

Not to mention if you don't remember a little detail of a 15 min video asking you how many lights someone ran before crashing and get the answer wrong, you have to watch it again to figure it out, only to end the video with a different question that is just as dumb to even remember.......

So before you know it, you've spent 45 mins re-watching a video over and over again because you can't just find that part with the info you needed..

Next time I have to take defensive driving, I'm NEVER using this again!! I'd rather just pay then have to deal with this ever again!!

Good and bad news

Good news and bad news. The good: I found this course to be helpful and instructive and would comfortably recommend it. The bad: I found inconsistencies that bring its quality down-- 1) The time requirements for each page are erratic, with some long pages only requiring 17-18 seconds, and -- the one that matters -- some short pages that require 2+ minutes even though the information is easily read and absorbed in far less time. (And yes, this would be true even for slow readers...); and 2) A personal pet peeve, grammar and punctuation and spelling errors (not a huge number, but I think a company of this size could be more attentive to these details).

I took the SafeWayDriving course on…4/8/2021

I took the SafeWayDriving course fpr teens by mistake; whad to take the one to get a ticket dismissed. There are a couple significant differences between the two courses; 1) the teens course suggests a way to get out of a skid is to "find a target, foot off gas/brake, steer to target" the instructor says "steering in the direction of the skid" will get you in trouble. The other course I took to get a ticket dismissed recommended the "steer in the direction of the skid" method. Also, teens course has a chart with alcohol absorption differences between males and females; there are significant differences. These discrepancies should be investigated in order to prevent confusing students in safe driving in Texas.

This course should be a requirement IN ADDITION TO the Drivers Training courses that our grandchildren are currently taking.

High Schools Should Teach This

This course is excellent in informing and educating people about crucial information that I had no idea about. This course did a great job to better help me understand rules of the road such that it is illegal to speed up as somebody is passing you while driving. I did not know that before taking this course. It also taught me valuable lessons to help maintain my own car such that breaking while turning can impose a greater wear and tear on your tires as opposed to breaking before turning your car. This course also does a great job of explaining the importance and responsibilities that come along with driving and encouraging good decisions such as not drinking and driving through providing a moving testimonial story of a daughter who was killed as a result of a man's drunk driving. There course should be expanded into high school and maybe even middle school classrooms to make sure the younger generation is learning all of this information that I and a lot of my fellow peers never learned.

If you want to receive your certificate be prepared to pay extra to have it shipped or you’ll never receive it

Free certificate delivery options are hidden until after you pass the course.

Certificate delivery options are over-priced. Upon purchasing the course, there was no option for free electronic delivery of my certificate. You could, however, buy an electronic certificate delivery which was the most expensive option. Then after taking the course, they present to you another opportunity to purchase an expedited certificate. If you decline, as I did, and elect to use the slowest delivery method, which was the "only free option" the website loads a new page where you are given the option to download a free electronic certificate. Interestingly, the option to go back to the previous page is disabled and the slow-but-free option and the suddenly-free-electronic-certificate option, are your only two options. The reason for this dishonest business practice is obvious: they want you to spend more money! If you refuse, they realize they can save money by not sending you a printed certificate at all. But since they know that electronic delivery will be the most popular option for the customer, they try diligently to charge you for it. Only after you have elected three times to accept snail mail as your only free option do they then offer you free electronic delivery. Don't be fooled into purchasing something that costs them nothing. Refuse to pay, and then, they will cave in and offer you the free electronic delivery to save themselves the shipping costs.

Content Needs Updating

I took the class to obtain a senior discount, but only about half of the content applied to senior drivers. The course content needs updating. The course was written around 2011 and a lot has changed — marijuana laws, features now included in cars that should be addressed as it relates to driving and accident avoidance, electric cars, the color of various fluids, and so forth. There is a timer for each slide, which allows too much time for introductory elements. The course could be improved by including videos and more interactive content. It gets boring reading through the pages.

I feel that Idrivesafely strived to teach me good driving habits but strayed once in a great while into relevant minutia.

I feel that Idrivesafely strived to teach people like me responsible, good, safe driving habits. What I also feel is that the course fell into the same problem that every good, well-intention course these days fall into - floods the learner with facts, figures, information, formal writing/speaking, words overly elegant and smart-sounding, and floods the learner with information. What I want and need is information about how to drive safely that I will remember three months, six months, one year, two years from now.....so concentrating on 'the bones' in as simple and declarative a way as possible to me seems to make sense. Your course does that to a good extent, but has more "icing on the cake" that I would want, if that makes any sense. But I might be wrong. Why test me on the accidental deaths in 2011? Why not more on the best way to deal with speeding drivers on the highway? Or drivers cutting around on city streets? or something more down to earth? How about, what do you do when you see a drunk driver ahead of you on a two-lane road? Make sure I know what I am doing when I get behind the wheel and please don't make me nervous about whether I should remember every little "fact" or term brought up in the discussion. That is what would make a better driver, I believe. Thank you for asking my opinion. You are definitely on the right track.

Had a wreck and needed defensive driving to cut down the fine costs

I had a wreck and my find was huge. To cut this in half I decided to take defensive driving. When I logged on to this course it was extremely easy to follow the instructions. What I liked most was that I could easily get in and out of it without time consuming searches. Another awesome aspect was that if I answered too many questions incorrectly, it would let me go through the section again until I could answer enough correct to pass. it was a pain sometime having to go through the entire section again but it gave me the opportunity to garner the information needed to pass the test for that section. On a personal level, I continue to think of some of the discussion during certain sections and I am using these suggestions to drive safely. I have been very nervous driving since I had the wreck but I feel more confident and aware since I took this course. I received my certificate immediately upon completion of the course and printed it off and saved it to my computer. I had not planned on getting my driving record through them because I did not want to pay the $20. But upon completion of the course I changed my mind. Having them get my driving record for me just took away so much stress and worry. And, by the time I printed off my course completion certificate and logged into my gmail account, my driving record was already emailed to me. i highly recommend this course for anyone. There was no hidden cost and I had the option to just read the pages or watch videos and since I was completing it at work I just read the pages and printed out the review pages when instructed to. There were a couple videos I had to watch but they had a transcript with each video. I give this course and the experience a 100% thumbs up. If you have to take the course, I recommend this one.

You can write a review if you’ve had a recent, genuine experience.

Reviews are your chance to share your experiences with others and give feedback to companies. Size doesn’t matter here, we think all experiences big and small are worth reviewing — whether it’s a phone call, an online order, a visit to your local store or otherwise using a company’s products or service.

Just keep it fresh by writing about your experience that happened in the past 12 months. While your story about buying a boombox in the 80s is cool, it’s less relevant for consumers looking to invest in today’s hi-tech audio products. When you share your recent experiences, other readers get a feel for how a company is operating now. And companies get valuable up-to-date feedback

I took and completed an iDriveSafely…

I took and completed an iDriveSafely course a few weeks later in October hoping to raise the points of my traffic ticket that I went to court a few weeks earlier for. I paid my ticket early in the month and was expecting my points to go from a +2 to a -1. Knowing that in the sate of VA ever drivers clinic course adds +5 to your driving record I was expecting it to be raised to a +4 to help me out. Well what ACTUALLY happened is iDriveSafely decided to submit my points EARLIER to the DMV before the court submitted their adjudication and it raised my points from a +2 to a +5 only for it to get lowered back down to a +2 again. I mean what was the point in paying you guys. So I contact their customer service and they said I need to talk to the DMV. Well anyone who knows the DMV can probably guess how that went down. They said too bad nothing we can do about it. So I wasted my money on these guys and did not get what I expected to get. I cannot recommend these guys to anyone if all they are going to do is screw over their customers

How to make a long course longer.

It had a lot of information and many good ideas how to drive safely. They are very helpful. However, I thought the course was overly long. True, I am a slow reader (though I read a lot of books in my leisure time), but it took me over 12 hours to get through. There was a lot of extraneous information as far as I was concerned. For example there was a section on traveling with children not having to do with safety concerns (how to keep them occupied during a long trip). Also pets, how to rent a car, etc. What does this have to do with a safety course? It makes a long course unnecessarily longer. Also the course I took was produced in 2012, making its (unnecessary) technology review outdfated.

Very informative and In-depth

The course itself was incredibly easy to understand, in depth, and informative! There were many videos and visuals to better explain the topics and they were very helpful. The course went over everything from rules of the road, to how to handle yourself in an accident, to how to drive anything from a car to an RV and trailer. The only thing I had a problem with was the time limits. For each passage of information there was a time limit varying from 1:00 (minute) to 10:30. They were very extensive and unnecessary. I dont disagree with the allowance of time limits, however, they were way too long. The passages with a 10 minute wait time only took maybe 2-4 minutes to read. That’s the only thing I would change, though. Overall I do think the course has made me a well-equipped and informed driver.

Admit you had an issue with data push or whatever, don’t deny the problem was yours when it so obviously was!

Everyone Should Take This Course

I took this test to get a deduction on my car insurance. It was provided to me by my insurance company and I really like the fact that I could take this test on line rather than having to take the time to go in to a class. I could take my time and go at my own pace and I liked that I could stop and come back to the on line class anytime. It was a lot of reading and it took longer than I thought it would, but it was best for me to finish each module and take the quiz right after while everything was still fresh in my mind. Some of the statistics were a bit much to remember all those numbers but overall it was very informative and I find I watch how I drive much more now. Easy to follow the flow of the modules. All went very smoothly and i didn't have any issues. Highly recommend this and actually think everyone should take this course as a good refresher on some of the driving rules, etc. Loved the convenience of doing this on line.

The "I Drive Safely" online course was…

The "I Drive Safely" online course was very comprehensive and covered quite a bit of content. Each page was timed, which I think is ultimately good and makes sure the student is staying on the page and reading the content.
I would suggest two improvements....
1.) Update the data in the program. It's not that it's not accurate, its' just that it's 12 years old....based on data from 2008.
2.) There were several pages where videos were available to watch....but the video might run for 35 sconds or 1 minute...but the required time on the page runs much longer than the video...so time is lost for the student waiting to advance to the next page.
3.) The program is advertised as "Fully Online"....although that is technically true...there should be more upfront explanation that the student must go to a testing center to take the final exam. That was a surprise once I got in the program. It was a pretty easy experience and the UPS Store was very helpful...even though the test is also "online"....it's not like you can take the entire course and test at home.
All that said, I WOULD recommend this program to others.

This has been the worst experience with…

This has been the worst experience with any driver's ed school that I have ever had. A month and a half ago I paid for the defensive driving course with expedited shipping because I needed it to remove some points on my license and reduce my insurance. A week after I had completed the course I was expecting the certificate of completion that never arrived. I decided to contact the company about it and they told me due to covid 19 the printing location was closed down temporarily. However he has been a month and a 1/2 and I still have not received my certificate and all they can tell me is to make sure that my address is correct but no one can tell me if he has even been printed. To me this seems to be just a scam and not a legitimate school concerned with their customers. I'll make sure to write a Yelp review and the Better Business Bureau because this companies to be investigated.

It's a good course BUT...

It's a good course. Very informative and educational. And not hard to do at all. BUT it's also very thorough and detailed. And theres a lot of talking and content (and) in some videos very boring!! I know a lot of reviewers say it keeps you from being bored so I guess it depends on the person. But for me I have mild to moderate ADD so I suppose that's why it gets too much for me. But I've been through many classes, meetings and seminars and they seem a lot less tedious than some of the videos in this course. There are some videos though that I felt were great! They helped more than the others. I especially liked the one about what to do when your car has mechanical problems and how to fix them. And what to do in emergency situations. This course is actually a little over 5 hours long. Not 4. And you have to take mini assessment tests after each chapter which are 7 chapters/sections to this course. And they are about 10 questions. After 7 you take the big one which is about 40 or 50 questions long. You can take up to 2 years to finish the course at your own pace. Although I wouldn't really reccommend it unless you're in high school. I'm trying to get my DL asap so I'm trying to finish mine in 2 weeks. Maybe that's why I'm stressed trying to take this course lol.
I guess that's all. I tried to write a review on idrivesafely Facebook page but it seems they are only allowing good reviews..

4 hour not very helpful

This course was not the best choice. The material is outdated, from 2016 and earlier. And miscellaneously dense. Lots of numbered micro-facts which are hidden in the text rather than laid out in the numbered bullet points. These little sneak factoids are generally included on unit tests, so if you answer incorrectly, once their answer is given the natural inclination would be to focus on those particular points so you don't mess up the final exam. But you will not see them on the final. The information is just too vague so not very important. You are constantly cautioned you must score 80% to pass. The final only has 40 questions, so you can at most miss 8 questions or achieve 32 correct answers. Trivia isn't helpful to make you a better driver. Don't pay more for voice information you can read along with the robot. The tone is dull and monotonous, without inflection and I thought it was too fast to follow well. Finally, there are hidden fees. I had to pay an additional $20 to have the passing notice sent to the county clerks office. The sign-up offer doesn't include that little bit of info, and if you have put the test off to the last minute, you will not be able to be sure the results arrive in time UNLESS you pay the $20 fee. I finished on a weekend and had to wait until the following Tuesday to be sure they'd received it. There are lots of different companies offering online services for these tests. Do yourself and favor and read reviews before you choose a provider. I wish I had. The useless material saturation and added hours made a 4 hour requirement into a two-week process.

SCAM - monthly roadside charge on credit card used for course $5 and can't cancel without spending hours

Upset there must have been some fine print that signed my Mom's credit card up for a $5 a month roadside assistance program. I have no recollection for signing up for this but my Mom's credit card, used for the course, is getting hit each month for a charge. i didn't need this as my parent's already have this on Texas's AAA as well as on our State Farm car insurance. Now I have been trying for almost an hour to cancel it. On the website the link to "Cancel" goes to a web page that says "web page not found". I did a chat with someone, probably offshore, that gave me a phone number that I had already been on hold for 30 minutes. I called again and it says press 2 to call back but that doesn't work. it says it will be 2 more minutes hold time -- it has said that 10 times now. This is a scam. Pick another course.
My Mom will probably have to cancel the credit card to stop the damn recurring charge!

This is the way to take course if you have to.

If you have to take a course, this is the way to do it. On your own time, at your own pace. I took the "Voluntary - Get 5 Safe Driving Points". I don't know if the other courses are different or not. I went ahead and also purchased the audio part, it reads it out loud to you. It was great for the long boring but necessary parts.
The quiz questions are rather specific for so much information. Surprisingly, the quizzes are more difficult than the final test itself, or maybe it just seemed that way because the course/quizzes prepared you for it so well.
Nonetheless, overall, it does make you aware of any bad driving habits you may have developed over the years. I think I am more cognizant of the proper way to drive. I am also definitely more mindful of my responsibility to be a defensive driver, because this course makes me very aware of how poorly many of the other drivers are on the road.
It's been a week and a half since I completed the course, and I am still thinking of the right and wrong things to do while on the road. Which I think is why the course is often required and or recommended by the courts. If everyone was a more mindful, law abiding, respectful driver, driving wouldn't often be so unpleasant.
If I ever have to take this course again, fingers crossed, I would definitely take this one.

Fast forward a year later, my car insurance went up $100 and when I called and asked why, they said the DMV never got my course completion. I’ve been trying to call idrivesafely for days and haven’t gotten through. If I don’t hear back from them by the 14th, my car insurance will be $200 every month for a year, and there’s nothing I, the courts or my car insurance can do.
Hopefully everyone else had a much better experience because I’m extremely frustrated.

Best Defensive Driving Course Online! Loved it!

If you ever find yourself in need to take the defensive driving course, either for court, or to just educate yourself, this is the perfect way to do it! Idrive safely offered me the best price online. I truly appreciated how audio was available, if you wanted, which would read and guide you through the lessons. This way helped me to better pay attention, and not lose interest during the course. Other sites had wanted extra money for pretty much the same features! Best of all was not having to wait on your certificate in the mail. I’d seen other sites, while looking around, where this wasn’t even an option. Not only was I able to print my official copy for the court, instantly following completion, I was given an official copy for my insurance company too. If you don’t have a printer, or access to one, they offered other options to get your certificate as quickly as you need. If you ever the need to take defensive driving, I highly recommend using Idrive safely!

Convenient Way To Experience Driving School

Convenient, Informative

The iDriveSafely program is a very convenient and flexible way to take a driving course. Whether you are doing it to improve your driving records or as a court-appointed course, this program is definitely worth it.

While sections are timed and you do have to complete the full 8 hours, you have the convenience and flexibility to do it on your own time. I was able to spread it across 2 (or 3) days and take the exam on the final day.

The course review is very informative and very helpful for the final exam. It may also help to take your own notes.

I would highly recommend anyone that needs to go to driving school to consider taking the iDriveSafely course!

Worthless customer service - worthless company

Do not choose this company, you only get to talk to foreign call centers that can do absolutely nothing for you. They insisted that my son's completion certificate had to be snail-mailed according to Oklahoma DPS rules. (It's a long story why we waited until the last minute to get the certificate). I work for DPS and called others within DPS and this is not the case. Some of the more reputable companies send instant email certificates as soon as you pass the final. iDriveSafely completely understands and apologizes for the inconvenience but refuses hit "send" to send a paying customer a copy of the certificate so a kid can get his license on his 16th birthday. This is the same certificate they claim to already have in the mail. They also refuse to let you talk to a real employee that could actually do something for you. Bottom line - they could've helped me they just refused to.

I personally think it would be helpful to include more information on road rage, texting and talking on the phone while driving, the new testing of self driving cars, dealing with the roads being inundated with Uber and Lyft drivers and less on the mechanics of an automobile, and guidelines for our new reality of having unpredictable heavy flooding in many areas, as well as wildfire avoidance and evacuation techniques and suggestions.

Also have an issue with the test results. When I got less than 80% I had to retake the test, which was fine, but you don’t give correct answers to the questions missed. The. Now, I am done with the 8 units and ready to take my final exam. I select the store where I want to take it, get a good night's sleep, and go to the store. They do not have any of my information, they say that I need to call idrivesafely and ask for the user information to log in to the computer. If I were not on a time crunch (thanks Thanksgiving) then I would not mind waiting. However, I should not have to take extra steps AFTER indicating which location I was taking my test. Be aware that you will have to do extra work and possibly spend extra time trying to get your information to the testing site. You'd think that with today's technology, they could automatically send that information to the store without any assistance from the user.

iDriveSafely was a very well thought out online traffic school class. I actually learned information I either had forgotten or was unaware that new laws had been written since my last drivers test. The chapters were organized in sensible and logical chapters. Not all of the demonstration videos played in my browser, but that didn't prevent me from passing my test. I liked the practice self tests at the end of the chapters to see where I might need to study more. However, I wished the final test had a better warning as to what mouse click was going to start it. Very bad service so far

The online course material is fine but there is a real problem after that point. Very bad after sales and customer service so far!!! BEWARE do not waste your money with this company if you can find another option! I completed all the online material and passed, was told at that point online that my pass would be forwarded to the DMV by the following day. I went into the DMV the following day and was told there that they had NOT received my record of completion from IDriveSafely. For 4 days in a row I have contacted IDriveSafely helpline and have been told each day the same thing, we will resolve this and you will be contacted within 24 hours to confirm. Each time they have failed to do this. Each day I have had to spend hours on hold, calling back and going through the exact same process with the operator every day to no avail. This has caused me half a day off work at the DMV, then four days waiting on hold for at least an hour each time and sometimes longer (2hours today)... Every time the same response and unfulfilled promises from the operator I deal with. Im sure it is not the operators fault but rather the company system and overall customer service makeup and hierarchy that is lacking woefully. The incompetence of the company is this area is quite astounding. Beware they will take your money and offer no real customer support in the end. So disappointing and frustrating!!!

Going for Driving, Go for I Drive Safely!

I had the best feeling as a customer or as a user, when I purchased I Drive Safely package for Adult defensive Driving. For starters, it is cheaper than other online sites which offer accredited certification. The outline of this course is divided into 10 parts, making the content really informative. At the end of every part there is a quiz, which keeps you on your toes. Also, there are personal questions asked in between the transition from one video to another, to make sure that actually the person who bought this program is following it and not someone else. And after all the toil of 6hrs, I was real confident and I had a great time giving the exam.

Great Course!

My friend recommended iDriveSafely. The fact it was online made me feel at ease to complete the 4 hour TLSAE course and pass the DHSMV exam. I was able to take the TLSAE course and exam with in a 5 days, at my own time and pace. The Practice exam for the learner's permit helped prepare me to take the actual exam. And some of the material covered on the exam was not only in the learner's license manual, it was also covered in the TLSAE course. The bundle was affordable and made things easy on us. I passed on the 1st try. My appointment was already set a couple of days after passing. It was a quick process to get the actual license, since the results are automatically send to the DHSMV. Highly recommended.

I enjoyed using a laptop

I enjoyed using a laptop, iPad and Android from anywhere to complete the course. I think there should be more information about how long the course is with the timers on each page. That way your potential customers are aware that there are for example "12 time logged hours worth of material that are being documented digitally to meet state requirements by law." I got through it in like 3 or 4 days but also needed mailing time I was unaware of for a total of 10 days of time for everything. Court dates and status hearings were in 11 days but almost didn't make it. My suggestion is more pressure and warnings to the student to sign up as soon as possible because that certificate is required in court and the judge can choose to decide to make new decisions that will not be in your favor. Tell them to not procrastinate because of these factors can be unpredictable their actual completion time. OR have a PDF email alternative in case the student needs a picture to show the judge.
Thanks again it was a great class.

Drive Safely Is A Must

Drive Safely was a very informative and a time friendly course. Felt that I learned more by the flexible course schedule rather than sitting in a room for five to six hours watching the time slowly go by. I used the work week to finish my course (Monday-Friday) and spent about an hour or two to work on the course. This way I never had to take time off work and was able to keep close to the house in case I needed to do some chores. I feel that Drive Safely should be more advertised for others trying to get points taken off their licenses or even to get a discount with ones insurance. I will absolutely recommend Drive Safely to a friend, family member or colleague. It’s worth it!!

Worth the money!

I purchased the iDriveSafely online course because I received a speeding ticket in Halifax, Virginia. (Word to the wise: If you are traveling through downtown Halifax, the speed limit is 25mph!) In the state of North Carolina, you must have points on your license in order to take a classroom Driver Safety course. I do not have any points on my license nor insurance. Fortunately, I was able to take an online class to meet the requirement in the state of Virginia.
I recommend this online course because you read the material at your own pace. At the end of each unit, you can print the review of material, which I did to help me answer the multiple choice questions. There are 10 multiple choice questions at the end of each unit. The final exam is 25 questions, and you must score an 80 in order to pass. I missed only 1 question and scored a 96!

The overall program was well designed…

The overall program was well designed to meet the goals set by the State. On a few pages, the timer ran longer than the movie so that was a little distracting. The extra seconds could be spread out and added to some of the reading only pages so that the need to fill the mandated 6 hours is not in such an obvious overrun position. Most users will not have spent a career as work mechanics so they will not have noticed the very few discrepancies between verb and subject (single and plural mixed as an example). However, having substitute taught in a local high school, I do know that most of the users will not even know the difference. The writing is well enough edited so that going through to correct the few errors would probably not be economically justified. It would only placate a few pedantic individuals and would not really add any understanding of concepts.

IDRIVESAFELY - Lots of Good Benefits

The IDRIVESAFELY course was a nice refresher of today's driving methods. This is one place that explains the changes in one's driving habits based on car design i.e. driving with hands at 8 and 4 due to airbags and their potential for harm during an accident. What it does not take in consideration is all the computerized changes to cars that provide for automatic braking, hands-free driving, in-lane driving etc. Todays cars provide for distance control as well if using cruise control; thereby, retaining the appropriate amount of space between cars or risk having the cruise control decrease putting control of the car back in the drivers hands. The statistical information provided in this course are: 1) interesting facts, 2) outdated and 3) not pertinent to how to drive a vehicle. I found topics such as: 1) how to deal with a tailgater, 2) medicine, alcohol and drug impact on driving (no, this was not my issue) and 3) how to tell if someone is impaired and what to do, far more important to today's drivers.
Its a shame motor vehicles can not send out a state/nationwide information pamphlet (hardcopy regular mail delivered) covering some of these topics. It could possibly decrease road rage by making people think about situations they experience.
I found a lot of good information to update my skills; just as there was outdated information driven by technology. I would recommend it to anyone needing a refresher on some driving methodologies, needing an extra 5 points added to their driver record or desiring to lower their insurance. Yes, I did pass first time taking the test :)

BEWARE--BEWARE--BEWARE: NO MOBILE CAPABILITY

If I could give this review LESS than one star, I would. One of the main reasons I signed up for Defensive Driving with this website was because it advertised (in multiple locations online) that users were able to access the course from any device, ie; mobile phones, tablets, ipads, or computers. I was using my cell phone to access the course and after the first few videos would not load, I decided to email customer support. They proceeded to respond to me and told me to close all other windows (I only had this webpage open in Safari on my phone), and then told me that currently their website does not support the use of mobile devices, tablets, or ipads. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!?!?! So I promptly emailed them demanding a refund and even sent screenshots of their website advertising the use of mobile and tablet devices. After waiting for 2 days without a response, I emailed them AGAIN and demanded a refund. Side Note: I looked online for a number to call to request a refund but could only find an email address and a FAX number. I got a response the next day and the rep told me they couldn't process refunds via email and that I would need to call customer service. Of course I let him know that I would have GLADLY done that rather than waiting had there been a number online for me to call. Needless to say, they ended up calling ME and informing me they were processing my refund. If I don't have my money back in my account in 10 days, I'll be calling and emailing AGAIN. BEWARE - all the 5 star reviews on here cannot be real - this website is a joke! Do not waste your time or money.

The disclaimer about the CDL licensed driver needs to be stated on the personal information page. This is a federal disqualification and not a state issue. The judicial avenues are extremely limited with a CDL license.

Legit course and wiped my traffic violation clean off my record!

I received a traffic ticket for an honest mistake, and was given the option to go to traffic school and have it wiped from my record. My local traffic school is only 1x per month and in different town than me. I took this course instead on recommendations from reviews saying it was legit, and was happy that the final completion certificate I submitted to the courts fully satisfied their traffic school request and removed the charge from me! Legit all the way! It took a lot of hours (probably would have been shorter to go to traffic school), but it was simple, straightforward and saved me from a physical class. FYI--to get the certificate emailed you have to pay extra, so don't want until last minute to complete the course, like me. I was able to submit a copy of the "unofficial" certificate to Oregon Courts without any problem, and did not have to order and submit the official copy that I otherwise would have had to have expedited.

The best way

Great for last-minute test takers. Clear, organized material and review tests and notes made for informative, painless, and successful completion. I highly recommend!

I opted to learn the material in written form. It’s the equivalent of a full-day class. I waited until the last-minute, so did it all at once. (California requires proof of completion to be sent to the courts electronically. I finished the morning of my last possible day. They recorded as such and submitted the next day. No issues on their part at all!) It would have been easy to divide it up into smaller sections to do over time. The material was presented in a clear, organized way. I liked that they had review notes and review tests after each chapter, plus an overall review section at the end, which you can print. As crazy as it sounds, since I didn’t go into the class to necessarily learn, I feel like I’m a better, more aware driver after taking this class. (I only took it to get out of a speeding ticket. I guess becoming a better, safer driver is the point of the course. Lol) I am going to have my teen driver do the equivalent class before he gets on the road...very informative and an eye-opener to have the statistics for different accidents/dangers presented as they were. Thank you!

Took it for a Virginia driver…

Took it for a Virginia driver improvement as required by the court (Note that you have to upload your court letter before beginning the course). There are various options depending on your needs. Format is text (included) or audio (additional $5). It goes page by page (like a textbook) and each page is timed ~30 sec., so you can't advance ahead because, by law, it's supposed to take 8 hrs like the offline course. You take the final exam offsite as required by law. Much better than wasting a day away because you can do it from the comfort of your home and just let it play out once you're finished reading.

Very organized & thorough

The program is very organized and detailed with 8 modules in the program. Even if you have been driving for more than 35 years (as I have), you will learn something new, perhaps confirm some things that you already do that you had learned/developed based on your experience. I do feel that the program could be condensed by 30% by focusing on principles of driving rather than individual categories (if that makes sense). Another recommendation would be to make the course more interactive, less passive, to better keep the attention of the audience. Perhaps driving games and scenarios that help participants practice the skills that are being discussed.

My experience with "I Drive Safely"…

My experience with "I Drive Safely" began after an accidental accident, whereas I was the driver. I was issued a citation, which I paid immediately. I was hurt during this accident and have some PTSD as a result. I took my safety class as directed and I won't be driving any more forever, per my own volition. The Driver Safety Class was fabulous. I really studied before I took the final exam. I was certified with an 80+ grade. The whole experience was fabulous, very worth the fee I had to pay. Its too bad this test can't be given to EVERYone with a license - BEFORE getting their license and followed up periodic classes throughout their lifetime. I was not proud that I rear-ended this person (I passed out for the split second it took to hit her). I will always be sorry to her for this event. I hope she is still ok. Please, take this class if you are ordered to do so, or better yet, take it if its available to anyone, whether its ordered to do so or not. Its a great class, I took mine online, on my own time and could refer back to it at any time.

OK. here is the afterward progress:
I resent my notarized affidavit form and received an email which is the confirmation of the completion of my course and said that my certificate will be reissued on the same day (Monday morning). I made a phone call, the consultant said that it would take 24 hours to process and I will get my certificate on Tuesday. Fine. I trusted them and waited until Tuesday noon around 12 pm. I didn't see any update. Since it had already been 24 hours since I received the first email. I called them again. The consultant said that it might take 24-48 hours and she could email her senior for check and put a request for my case and I could get my certificate this afternoon. I trusted her again. The consultant said that my case went to the technical department and there may be some technical issue about this. It would take more times. But I could get my certificate on Wednesday if no more information was needed. And she would let me know and call me back if there is any update or any reply from the processing department! This is the last time I trusted this. I do hope I can get my certificate tomorrow (Wednesday). I have nothing to say with customer service. All consultants are friendly. But this company is really inefficient. I am not sure whether I can get my valid certificate before the due date to dismiss my ticket. You can hardly image issuing a valid certificate will take so much time. Finally I got reissued certificate on Wednesday and will check its validation in 5 days on TDLR website.

I wish I could give this course a "0"

I wish I could give this course a "0". What a nightmare! I am posting in my FB page and senior groups NEVER TO USE THIS COMPANY. Also writing letters to the FL DMV, AG, and Consumer Protection agencies.

Complaints:
1) The material is full of grammatical errors
2) The "review" pages do not contain the questions on the mini-quiz for that chapter
3) The corrections page after the quiz does NOT tell you the correct answers to any questions missed, and the info on that page does not relate in any way to the material from that chapter. So the student cannot learn from his/her mistakes
4) The Review Page attached to the course is from 2010, NINE YEARS OLD! No wonder they kept quoting figures from 2005! The review document is 9 years out of date!
5) The Review document is not tailored to the course material, it is generic. A teen driver course should have material geared to that course, mature drivers should have a review for that course.
6) There is NO PHONE, CHAT, OR EMAIL CONTACT on the main page, or even a "Contact Us" page. I had to find it on the GetHuman website.
7) There are NO TERMS AND CONDITIONS anywhere on the website. They are only presented on the "Payment" page at the end of the course. This is ILLEGAL.
8) The website clearly states that this course is accessible by ANY DEVICE, and yet, when their software fails repeatedly (as in the mini-exam issue), the tech support claims that it is the customer's fault if using a tablet. What?! No accountability at all.
9) On the payment page at the end, the price for 2-day delivery was $17, but on the next page with CC info, the charge was $19, so I had to call AGAIN to try to straighten this out, and was told that there was no "back" button to get to the previous page, and neither could the cust service reps. UNACCEPTABLE! THEN, they told me that 2-day FedEx is only for 2 BUSINESS DAYS, NOT 2 calendar days.

In short, this course needs to be decertified until the company can start to act like a real company instead of some outfit run out of someone's pickup truck. Disgraceful, by any professional standard. I consider it fraudulent business practice. FRAUD.

Save yourselves. Save your money. Pick a different course.

I'm 17 and this is the first driving course I've ever taken. I have to tell you- it's such a disappointment. Probably the only good thing is that I haven't had to contact customer service yet- I've heard from other reviews that it's terrible.

The course takes absolutely forever to finish, even though it's advertised as one of the shortest. Every single page has an allotted amount of time you have to spend there, and it was usually between 3-7 minutes more than I needed. If you're a fast reader, bring something else to do. I have been working on this course on and off for over a year and still do not have my licence.

The testing situation on their website is also very messed up. The website asks parents at the end of every module to "review the questions your teen missed on the quiz" even though there wasn't a quiz anywhere in the material. The few review tests that there are are not very thorough, all the same format, and very easy to pass.

In addition, the material in iDriveSafely's course is horrible quality and horribly organized. The lessons are very repetitive and not at all interactive. Their videos are outdated and extremely negative. Driving is depicted is so dangerous that I almost forgot why am wanted to learn in the first place. Often, when I'm behind the wheel of my car, I get anxiety attacks and flashbacks from the gory images shown in the videos.

Overall, if you want to be frustrated, stressed out, and the last one of your friends to get a driver's licence, iDrive Safely is the course for you! Wish me luck finishing this nightmare.

$250 for a week's worth of aggrevation

First I took a picture of it, waited a couple of days, only for them to tell me it wasn't good enough. So I traced over the parts that were faded, went and got it scanned, and tried to upload it. It didn't give me any message, just sent me back to the same page, so I assumed it had gone through. Wait a day, check again, nothing. So I try again, I convert it to two other formats, try to submit each one, nothing. I wait until the morning, call them, and I get an email address, to which I send the scan. When they finally get back to me, it's to say it's not good enough. So I type out all of the information they request and email it back. Still not good enough, and now they send me back the original picture, not the scan that I sent later. So I called again, guy at customer support said he'd have to take it up with a supervisor and call me back in half an hour. I never got a call back. Now I have to wait until morning when their call center in India is open again.

I have four days left to take this course, and I'm no closer to starting it than I was five days ago.

Given the number of negative reviews with similar complaints, I'm not sure that there's any real point to emailing them at their "wecare" email address. I believe they care about their ratings when they get negative reviews, but I don't believe they really care about their customers. They are spending their money on Google Ads to get the number one spot when someone searches for "traffic school" or similar terms, but not on updating/correcting their content and definitely not on staffing real customer service agents who are available at the published phone number. Texas Drivers Education

The course itself is easy. The live action videos are cheesy and a little outdated but overall it makes it easy to pass the quizzes and the final exam. After completing the course, however, I started running into issues. First, I paid for the course and selected the FREE standard USPS mailing, and was told if I completed my course before 3 PM, they would ship it the same business day. Awesome, right? Makes it way easier for me. I completed the course around 5 AM on a Friday, and only received a downloadable certificate. The screen before downloading told me that I needed to print the certificate and fill out a DE-964 form (Drivers Education Certificate Order Form)…. Why would I need to print the certificate and fill out this form so I pay can for a hard copy if they are supposed to send me a hard copy of my certificate through the mail? I never received the confirmation email for the shipping of my certificate, even though it was a business day and before 3 PM. Second issue I ran into was receiving an E-mail stating that "Its Time to Drive" prompting me to go to their partner site, DriversEd.com, and buy 150$ driving lessons because I only completed the online portion of DE? They told me that I am required to have 7 hours of behind-the-wheel training and 7 hours of driving observation.... While the DPS website states that the Traditional Drivers Ed requires both classroom and behind-the-wheel training, that is not what I signed up for. I signed up for 100% ONLINE Texas Adult Drivers Education, which does NOT require behind-the-wheel training. No where on I Drive Safely's website does it state that this is a "partial certificate program" either.... I see this as a trick to try and get more money out of people, making them believe that this is a requirement when it really isn't. All in all, I don't think I would recommend them, what's done is done for me as far as the Drivers Education course goes but they are a little unorganized and misleading. I was considering taking the Insurance course to lower my car insurance, but after receiving my license I think I will opt for an in-classroom Defensive Driving course, which will cost a little more but I am sure will be a better and more organized and up front experience.
I have already emailed the care support team, and am waiting for a reply.

Please help.

I passed Texas Adult Driver Education Course, but I do not know when you mail Certificate for me. Please inform to my email, Thanks and best regards.

I just completed my course for…

I just completed my course for dismissing my ticket. Overall okay experience, you know how these go. Have to sit here for hours to just bull crap your way through it. Nonetheless, the only problem I had prior to actually even starting my course was the fact that it made me pay for an eCertificate that I didn't really want. It was $15 extra on top of the $25 I'm normally supposed to pay for. Crazy thing is, is that there was no option for me to not buy it or in other words take it off of my checkout/total. Kinda seemed like it was a package deal but there wasn't an option to just buy the regular $25 package I wanted to pay for. looked all through out the page to try and see if it was possible to not get the eCertificate but it was kinda like it was forcing me to but it. So my dumb self went a long with it only because I need to turn this certificate course in soon. Fast forward, I finish the course, go through the process of finalizing and theres screen that comes up and says "would you like to speed up your shipping process" or something like that. offers you 2 day shipping etc. for more money. The only other option there was for me-becuase I didn't want to pay more, was to click on the option that said something like "I will stick to my eCertificate (already purchased)" which I thought was stupid because it wasn't even what I wanted in the first place. It also didn't tell me if I chose this option that I will still get my certificate in the mail. Like I want to know if I'm getting it in the mail or not don't make me assume. I thought this was extremely frustrating and I'm trying to get my money back for the unnecessary 15.

Its trash

Its trash. Why, becuase i spent $45 dollars on a package that said "Florida TLSAE Course+Online Permit Test." I finished the course and did the test, the screen later said passed with 98% "print this paper out." I went to the DMV took about 3 hours for me to go up to the counter for them to tell me that the test I took WAS NOT the Permit test. I could have sworn I took the test so I call IDriveSafely and they tell me, "oh that wasn't the permit test, that was all practice blah blah blah." I was left in disbelief. I hope IDriveSafely sees this so they know to CHANGE THE NAME OF THE DAMN PACKAGE so people don't WASTE 35-45 dollars on a PRACTICE TEST THAT SAYS ITS THE PERMIT TEST. Wate of time and money. If your going to use this website make sure what your buying says Florida Online Permit Test (of course if you don't live in Florida it should say the state you live in)and double check if in any other way possible. WARNING: THIS WEBSITE WILL TRICK YOU TO PAY FOR SOMETHING THAT ISNT WHAT YOU THINK IT IS. THEY DONT EVEN HAVE A WAY TO TELL THEM HOW MUCH THEIR WEBSITE SUCKS OR LEAVE RECOMMENDATIONS.

WASTE OF MY TIME

I have paid my money to the “Drug & Alcohol and also for the Permit Exam” package. I purchased it before my 18th birthday, and since it took me many hours, I did not finish it on the same day. It took my a bit of time to finally have the time and finish the exams, especially my Permit exam. It said, “CONGRATULATIONS, you have passed with an 85%, now we will send your certificate to the DMV and receive your completion of your permit.”
It’s been a month later, that I realized I had no record or receipt or proof that I had finished this permit exam. So I called and asked about my info.
They said no I did NOT complete it because the next day, I turned 18.
The PROBLEM is that they did NOT send me a notification of no such that the exam has been DECLINED this WHOLE time.
They did NOT give me a refund because the “30 days” has passed already, BUT HOW WAS I SUPPOSE TO KNOW THAT I NEEDED TO CALL THEM FOR A REFUND IF THEY NEVER TOLD ME, MY PERMIT EXAM HAS BEEN DELCINED!
They tricked me....it’s not fair for me to waste my days on this and especially my money on it.
They psychologically messed with my mind, letting ME, a Customer, believe that I have passed during this whole time >:(
It’s not fair .......

outdated, not really helpful

so I HAD to write a review, will this get u a certificate yeah, but do they give a hoot about their customers, not really. there website has a spot where u can email them for information, but they haven't updated their captcha so its useless. theres a spot which lets you test out the validation procedure and asks u to call to make sure it works but you call and it asks for a pin THAT YOU DONT HAVE and cant get until it generates one for you during the course thus there is no way to actually test anything out and it took me half an hour to get to talk to someone on the phone after pressing so many button options half of which dont even make sense. lastly there is errors in their course, which is why i wanted to call their tech support but waited half an hour on the phone non of the options made sense and waited half an hour to get in contact with someone but couldnt (hence why i wanted to email which I CANT) ... there course has one spot where it states

"The location of 30 seconds on the road ahead will vary depending on your speed :

Traveling at 25 mph, 30 seconds ahead is about two and one half blocks.

At 30 mph, 30 seconds ahead is close to two blocks."

This logically doesn't make sense. You cannot drive faster within the same time span and get a lesser distance.

so all in all if u can settle with just getting a certificate and reading statistics from 2011 and hardly getting any customer support this is the place for you, but you are really just filling their pockets because they will never update the site and hardly answer their phones.

A VERY DECENT REFRESHER COURSE

The I DRIVE SAFELY course is a well structured refresher course which gives the participant an opportunity to review the basic principles of safe driving in a comprehensive manner. I definitely became more aware of the areas of my own driving skills which could be improved, particularly when the material focused on the statistics of roadway accidents. Whether the course actually influences anyone to change their driving practices would require research ( which may have been done already) but taking this course certainly has made me more "aware" while on the road, which is a good outcome.The cost of the program is very reasonable and couldn't be more convenient than sitting at your computer for a learning experience.
Having taken safe drive classes in the past, the only drawback might be if you prefer interacting with others to the presented material for discussion purposes. Don't know what could have been done to make it 5 stars, but 4 feels just right.

Course was good. Some questions wanted statistics answers. I took notes and screen shots, but didn't get all the stats. That took longer, but I feel like I got more out of it too. One other thing, the quiz info is only available at the time of the quiz. You can't look back on it. So if you do take notes or screen shots remember to capture those too.

Also, I opted for the certificate thru the mail. After more than 2 weeks had passed, I became concerned. My pessimist self wondered -- is it their way to get more $? They proved me wrong on that by agreeing to send 2-day at their expense. I was very positively impressed.
